messages.content:
Updated README.md with 96 additions and 2 removals         1    # CODITECT
         2    
         3 -  AI-Powered Development Framework
         3 +  AI-Powered Development Framework - System-wide distribution
           +  with automatic updates.
         4    
         5 -  ## Installation
         5 +  ## One-Click Installation
         6    
         7    ```bash
         8    curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/halcasteel/cod
             itect/main/install.sh | bash
         9    ```
        10 +  
        11 +  ## What Gets Installed
        12 +  
        13 +  - **Location**: `/opt/coditect` (read-only, 
           + admin-controlled)
        14 +  - **User symlink**: `~/.coditect`
        15 +  - **Claude integration**: `~/.claude/` (commands, skills, 
           + agents)
        16 +  - **Auto-updates**: Daily at 9:00 AM via launchd
        17 +  
        18 +  ## Features
        19 +  
        20 +  - **46 specialized AI agents** for development tasks
        21 +  - **72 slash commands** for Claude Code
        22 +  - **189 reusable skills** for automation
        23 +  - **Export deduplication** for context management
        24 +  - **Multi-agent orchestration** capabilities
        25 +  
        26 +  ## Usage
        27 +  
        28 +  ### In Any Project
        29 +  ```bash
        30 +  # Create project-specific symlink
        31 +  ln -s ~/.coditect .coditect
        32 +  ```
        33 +  
        34 +  ### Manual Update
        35 +  ```bash
        36 +  /opt/coditect/update.sh
        37 +  ```
        38 +  
        39 +  ### Check Version
        40 +  ```bash
        41 +  git -C /opt/coditect log -1 --oneline
        42 +  ```
        43 +  
        44 +  ## For Administrators
        45 +  
        46 +  ### Push Updates
        47 +  Updates are automatically distributed to all users daily at
           +  9:00 AM.
        48 +  
        49 +  ```bash
        50 +  # Make changes to this repo
        51 +  git add . && git commit -m "Update description" && git push
        52 +  ```
        53 +  
        54 +  ### Override Installation
        55 +  ```bash
        56 +  # Different branch
        57 +  CODITECT_BRANCH=develop curl -fsSL https://raw.githubuserco
           + ntent.com/halcasteel/coditect/main/install.sh | bash
        58 +  
        59 +  # Different repo
        60 +  CODITECT_REPO=https://github.com/your-org/coditect-fork.git
           +  curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/halcasteel/cod
           + itect/main/install.sh | bash
        61 +  ```
        62 +  
        63 +  ## Uninstall
        64 +  
        65 +  ```bash
        66 +  # Remove installation
        67 +  sudo rm -rf /opt/coditect
        68 +  
        69 +  # Remove user symlink
        70 +  rm ~/.coditect
        71 +  
        72 +  # Remove auto-updater
        73 +  launchctl unload 
           + ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.coditect.updater.plist
        74 +  rm ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.coditect.updater.plist
        75 +  
        76 +  # Remove Claude integration
        77 +  rm ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md ~/.claude/commands ~/.claude/skills 
           + ~/.claude/agents
        78 +  ```
        79 +  
        80 +  ## Architecture
        81 +  
        82 +  ```
        83 +  /opt/coditect/              # System-wide (read-only)
        84 +  ├── install.sh              # Installer
        85 +  ├── update.sh               # Auto-updater
        86 +  ├── CLAUDE.md               # Main config
        87 +  ├── agents/                 # 46 AI agents
        88 +  ├── commands/               # 72 slash commands
        89 +  ├── skills/                 # 189 skills
        90 +  ├── scripts/                # Utility scripts
        91 +  └── orchestration/          # Multi-agent coordination
        92 +  
        93 +  ~/.coditect -> /opt/coditect   # User symlink
        94 +  ~/.claude/                      # Claude Code integration
        95 +  ├── CLAUDE.md -> /opt/coditect/CLAUDE.md
        96 +  ├── commands -> /opt/coditect/commands
        97 +  ├── skills -> /opt/coditect/skills
        98 +  └── agents -> /opt/coditect/agents
        99 +  ```
       100 +  
       101 +  ## License
       102 +  
       103 +  Proprietary - All rights reserved.

messages.content:
Complete

  Created:
  - GitHub repo: https://github.com/halcasteel/coditect
  - Submodule: coditect-rollout-master/submodules/coditect

  Files:
  - install.sh - One-click installer
  - update.sh - Auto-updater (runs daily via launchd)
  - README.md - Documentation

  ---
  End User Experience

  Install:
  curl -fsSL
  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/halcasteel/coditect/main/install.sh |
  bash

  What happens:
  1. Clones to /opt/coditect (read-only)
  2. Creates ~/.coditect symlink
  3. Sets up auto-updates (daily at 9 AM)
  4. Integrates with Claude Code (~/.claude/)

  ---
  Next Step

  You need to populate the repo with CODITECT content (agents, commands,
  skills, scripts, etc.) before the installer will be useful.

  Would you like me to copy the content from .coditect or
  coditect-project-dot-claude into this new distribution repo?

> coditect-project-dot-claude is where the content is why would I copy it?

messages.content:
You're right - that's redundant. The installer should just install
  coditect-project-dot-claude directly.

  Two options:

  1. Update installer to use coditect-project-dot-claude
    - Change CODITECT_REPO in install.sh to point to
  coditect-project-dot-claude
    - The coditect repo just becomes the installer host
  2. Add coditect-project-dot-claude as submodule of coditect
    - coditect repo contains installer + submodule reference
    - More indirection but keeps installer separate

  Recommended: Option 1 - simpler, no extra layer.

  Want me to update the installer to clone coditect-project-dot-claude
  instead?

  # In install.sh, change:
  CODITECT_REPO="https://github.com/halcasteel/coditect-project-dot-claude.g
  it"

> 1

messages.content:
Currently it's manual (documented in README):

  # Remove installation
  sudo rm -rf /opt/coditect

  # Remove user symlink
  rm ~/.coditect

  # Remove auto-updater
  launchctl unload ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.coditect.updater.plist
  rm ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.coditect.updater.plist

  # Remove Claude integration
  rm ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md ~/.claude/commands ~/.claude/skills
  ~/.claude/agents

  Want me to create an uninstall.sh script for one-click removal?

  curl -fsSL
  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/halcasteel/coditect/main/uninstall.sh |
  bash

> yes

       16 +  BLUE='\033[0;34m'
       17 +  NC='\033[0m'
       18 +  
       19 +  # Parse arguments
       20 +  CHECK_ONLY=false
       21 +  FORCE=false
       22 +  QUIET=false
       23 +  
       24 +  while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
       25 +      case $1 in
       26 +          --check|-c) CHECK_ONLY=true; shift ;;
       27 +          --force|-f) FORCE=true; shift ;;
       28 +          --quiet|-q) QUIET=true; shift ;;
       29 +          --help|-h)
       30 +              echo "CODITECT Updater"
       31 +              echo ""
       32 +              echo "Usage: update.sh [OPTIONS]"
       33 +              echo ""
       34 +              echo "Options:"
       35 +              echo "  --check, -c    Check for updates without
          +  installing"
       36 +              echo "  --force, -f    Force update even if 
          + up-to-date"
       37 +              echo "  --quiet, -q    Suppress output (for 
          + cron/launchd)"
       38 +              echo "  --help, -h     Show this help"
       39 +              exit 0
       40 +              ;;
       41 +          *) shift ;;
       42 +      esac
       43 +  done
       44 +  
       45    log() {
       46 -      echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a 
          -  "$LOG_FILE"
       46 +      echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" >> "$LOG_FILE"
       47 +      if [ "$QUIET" = false ]; then
       48 +          echo -e "$1"
       49 +      fi
       50    }
       51    
       52    # Check if installation exists
       53    if [ ! -d "$INSTALL_DIR/.git" ]; then
       54 -      log "ERROR: CODITECT not installed at $INSTALL_DIR"
       54 +      log "${RED}ERROR: CODITECT not installed at $INSTALL_DIR
          +  ${NC}"
       55        exit 1
       56    fi
       57    
     ...

       31    LOCAL=$(git rev-parse HEAD)
       32    REMOTE=$(git rev-parse "origin/$CODITECT_BRANCH")
       33 +  LOCAL_SHORT=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)
       34 +  REMOTE_SHORT=$(git rev-parse --short 
          + "origin/$CODITECT_BRANCH")

       37 -      log "Already up-to-date"

       39    fi
       40    
       41 -  # Update available
       42 -  log "Update available: $LOCAL -> $REMOTE"
       41 +  # Get commit info
       42 +  COMMITS_BEHIND=$(git rev-list --count 
          + HEAD..origin/$CODITECT_BRANCH)
       43 +  LATEST_MSG=$(git log -1 --format="%s" 
          + origin/$CODITECT_BRANCH)
       44    
       45 +  if [ "$CHECK_ONLY" = true ]; then
       46 +      log "${YELLOW}Update available!${NC}"
       47 +      log "  Current: ${LOCAL_SHORT}"
       48 +      log "  Latest:  ${REMOTE_SHORT} (${COMMITS_BEHIND} 
          + commits behind)"
       49 +      log "  Message: ${LATEST_MSG}"
       50 +      log ""
       51 +      log "Run 'coditect-update' to install update"
       52 +      exit 0
       53 +  fi
       54 +  
       55 +  # Update available - install it
       56 +  log "${BLUE}Installing update...${NC}"
       57 +  log "  ${LOCAL_SHORT} -> ${REMOTE_SHORT} (${COMMITS_BEHIND} 
          + commits)"

       61    sudo git submodule update --init --recursive

       50    sudo find "$INSTALL_DIR" -type f \( -name "*.sh" -o -name 
            "*.py" \) -exec chmod 755 {} \;
       51    
       52 -  log "Updated successfully to $(git rev-parse --short HEAD)"
       52 +  log "${GREEN}Updated successfully!${NC}"

       54 +  log "  Message: ${LATEST_MSG}"

messages.content:
Done. Update behavior:

  Hourly background checks:
  - Silent when up-to-date (no output, no notification)
  - macOS notification only when update is installed

  User commands:
  coditect-update     # Update now
  coditect-check      # Check without installing
  coditect-version    # Show current version

  Flags:
  coditect-update --check   # Same as coditect-check
  coditect-update --force   # Force reinstall
  coditect-update --quiet   # Suppress console output

> how are they going to be aware that there is an update?

messages.content:
Now the flow is:

  1. Hourly background check (silent)
  2. If update available → macOS notification: "X update(s) available. Run:
  coditect-update"
  3. User decides when to install → coditect-update

  Users are in control - notified but not auto-updated.

> how do they install?

  Installing update...
    abc123 -> def456 (3 commits)
  Updated successfully!
    Version: def456
    Message: Add new feature X

  The notification text tells them exactly what to run: "X update(s)
  available. Run: coditect-update"

Done. Users now have two ways to manage updates:

  Terminal commands:
  coditect-update     # Install updates
  coditect-check      # Check for updates
  coditect-version    # Show version

  Claude Code slash commands:
  /coditect-update    # Install updates
  /coditect-check     # Check for updates
  /coditect-version   # Show version

  Both work - terminal for quick access, slash commands for within Claude
  Code sessions.

messages.content:
Good question. Key things that might be missing:

  Critical:
  1. Source repo accessible? - Installer clones
  halcasteel/coditect-project-dot-claude - is that repo public on GitHub?
  2. LICENSE file - No license in the distribution repo

  Important:
  3. Version/CHANGELOG - No version tags or release notes
  4. Rollback - No way to revert a bad update
  5. Health check - Command to verify installation is working
  6. Requirements doc - macOS only currently (launchd), needs git

  Nice to have:
  7. Linux support - launchd is macOS-specific
  8. Troubleshooting guide - Common issues and fixes
  9. Configuration - Update frequency preferences
  10. First-run verification - Test that everything works after install

  Most urgent: Is halcasteel/coditect-project-dot-claude a public GitHub
  repo? The installer will fail if it can't clone it.

  Want me to address any of these?

> can we include our logo in the install process?
